body:
Yes. Previously (before the openmp patch for `add/prod`), I implemented the `and` and 'all' via macros, we only needed to write the function (as a macro definition) once then use macro to get `add/prod/all/any`. However after the openmp patch, the function itself use macros to detect if openmp exists, then it's impossible to definition to define the function as a macro definition (due to the need for nested macro definition, the `#ifdef` will need to occur inside a macro).

It's quite uncomfortable to copy-and-paste, but I think there's  no better choice :(
